channel.title: Eye Toy for Windows
channel.description:
I have an Eye toy and tried to install it on my computer, wich didnt work. i've done allot of google searches and they all say the same thing wish doesnt work. When i plug the eye toy into the usb port , normally there should pop up a "Found new hardware wizard" thingy but that doesnt pop up with my computer and i dont know why.
Any solutions?

Or you can just go out and buy a ps2…

item.title: Eye Toy for Windows
item.dc:creator: @Texasmd91 Texasmd91
item.description:
@Texasmd91 wrote:

go to your control panel, click “add hardware” then it will search, if it doesnt find anything say you already connected it, then a list will popup, select it. Try that?

Read full topic

item.title: Eye Toy for Windows
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“The Cursed, post:15, topic:79805”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=117171.msg1168686#msg1168686 date=1176766526]

i’m not a complete retard, i did a thousand google searches about the eye toy for windows, and i know you need drivers for it but the thing is that on every single tutorial for installing it on your computer it says that there should pop up a “new hardware found” thingy but, it doesnt…

(TheBeanie, i added you)

Can’t you just install the driver without the Hardware wizard popping up?
http://eyetoy8057.sourceforge.net/cms/modules.php?name=Downloads&d_op=viewdownload&cid=7
[/quote]

in wich directory do i put the files then?[/quote]

The link I posted is an executable file, /me thinks it should do that for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Eye Toy for Windows
item.dc:creator: @Texasmd91 Texasmd91
item.description:
@Texasmd91 wrote:

You can certainly use your EyeToy on your computer...

The picture quality is SWEEEEEETTTT…

Go to www.driverguide.com and search 4 the EyeToy Driver and install it on your computer…

Connect your EyeToy to your computer and when it comes up with install with cd and browse folder, choose the browse folder option and locate the folder the drivers you installed are in…

Did you even try to google “Eye Toy for the computer”?

Read full topic

item.title: Eye Toy for Windows
item.dc:creator: @Firion Firion
item.description:
@Firion wrote:

Well, I had this problem with an mp3 before. The reason it won’t work on your computer is because there was either a corrupted file that came with the CD (If at all), or there were installation problems while it was installing.

Read full topic

item.title: Eye Toy for Windows
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“The Cursed, post:5, topic:79805”][quote author=Fr33sc4p3 link=topic=117171.msg1154447#msg1154447 date=1176574291]
http://www.google.com/search?sourceid=navclient-ff&ie=UTF-8&rlz=1B2RNFA_enGB214GB214&q=eye+toy

For playstation, thank you
[/quote]
http://www.google.com/search?hl=nl&rlz=1B2RNFA_enGB214GB214&q=eye+toy+webcam&btnG=Zoeken&lr=

For windows, thank you[br][size=1]Posted on: April 14, 2007, 07:13:20 AM[/size][hr]any help?[/quote]

I love how every link from google says something about it being for the PS2.

I have no idea id an Eye Toy was released for Windows, but you need the drivers. It should have came with a cd, or directions to get it online. If not, you got ripped.

edit: Hmmm so it seems your trying to mod it for use on your PC? What a waste of an eye toy, just buy a webcam for 20 bucks…

Read full topic
